alert.note: Alert for Coastal Kleberg; Coastal Nueces; Inland Nueces; Kleberg Islands; Nueces Islands (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 10:50AM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Nueces and northeastern Kleberg Counties through 1130 AM CDT... At 1050 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cabaniss Field, or over Corpus Christi, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Corpus Christi, Del Mar College Windward Campus, Flour Bluff, Corpus Christi Country Club, Packery Channel, South Texas Botanical Gardens, Cabaniss Field, Kings Crossing Subdivision, Padre Balli Park, Bay Area Medical Center, Cole Park, Mustang Island State Park, Spohn Hospital South, Driscoll Childrens Hospital, Del Mar College Heritage Campus, Texas A&M University Corpus Christi, Waldron Field, Downtown Corpus Christi, La Palmera Mall and Corpus Christi Naval Air Station. This includes the following highways... Interstate 37 between mile markers 1 and 3. US Highway 181 near mile marker 648. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Kleberg; Coastal Nueces; Inland Nueces; Kleberg Islands; Nueces Islands
